channel.title: How To on Magic Modules
channel.description: Recent content in How To on Magic Modules

item.title: Types of resources
item.description: Check the header in the Go source to determine what type of resource it is. If there is no header, it is likely handwritten.

item.title: Add an MMv1 resource
item.description: Generated resources are created using the mmv1 code generator, and are configured by editing definition files under the mmv1/products path.

item.title: Add MMv1 IAM resources
item.description: For resources implemented through the MMv1 engine, the majority of configuration for IAM support can be inferred based on the preexisting YAML specification file.

item.title: Add an MMv1 test
item.description: An example terraform configuration can be used to generate docs and tests for a resource.

item.title: Add and update MMv1 resource documentation
item.description: Generated resources have generated documentation. This page describes the generation process and what YAML inputs are used.

item.title: Update a handwritten resource
item.description: The Google providers for Terraform have a large number of handwritten go files, primarily for resources written before Magic Modules was used with them. Most handwritten files are expected to stay handwritten indefinitely, although conversion to a generator may be possible for a limited subset of them.

item.title: Add a handwritten test
item.description: For handwritten resources and generated resources that need to test update, handwritten tests must be added.

item.title: Add a handwritten datasource
item.description: Datasources are like terraform resources except they don’t create anything.

item.title: Add handwritten IAM resources
item.description: Handwritten IAM support is only recommended for resources that cannot be managed using MMv1.

item.title: Update handwritten provider documentation
item.description: Handwritten resources and datasources have handwritten documentation that needs to be updated in PRs.

item.title: Add documentation for a handwritten data source
item.description: New handwritten datasources require new handwritten documentation to be created.
